text: Woes on the Wicked
Ah! Those who decree decrees of evil,
and writers who have written harm,
to guide \add the\add* needy away from legal claims,\f + \fr 10:2 \ft Hebrew “claim” \f*
and to rob the justice from the poor of my people,
to make widows their spoil;
and they plunder orphans.
And what will you do at \add the\add* day of punishment,
and at calamity? It comes from afar!
To whom will you flee for help,
and where will you leave your wealth,
⸤save that they bow down under the prisoners
and fall under the slain⸥?\f + \fr 10:4 \ft Literally “except he will bow down under a prisoner and under slain they will fall”; “under” could also mean “in the place of” \f*
In all of this his anger has not turned away,
and still his hand \add is\add* stretched out.
Judgment on Assyria’s Arrogance
Ah! Assyria, the rod of my anger,
and a staff is in their hand: my wrath!
I send him against a godless nation,
and I command him against the people of my wrath,
to capture spoil
and to carry off plunder,
and to make them\f + \fr 10:6 \ft Hebrew “him” \f* a trampling place,
like \add the\add* clay of \add the\add* streets.
But he does not think this,\f + \fr 10:7 \ft Or “so” \f*
and his heart does not plan this.
For \add it is\add* in his heart to destroy
and to cut off not a few nations.
For he says, “\add Are\add* not my commanders altogether kings?
\add Is\add* not Calno like Carchemish?
\add Is\add* not Hamath like Arpad?
\add Is\add* not Samaria like Damascus?
As my hand has reached to the kingdoms of the idols\f + \fr 10:10 \ft Hebrew “idol” \f*
—and their images were ⸤greater than those of⸥\f + \fr 10:10 \ft Literally “from” \f* Jerusalem and Samaria—
shall I not do to Jerusalem and its idols
what I have done to Samaria and her idols?”

And this shall happen: when the Lord has finished all his work against ⸤Mount Zion⸥\f + \fr 10:12 \ft Literally “the mountain of Zion” \f* and Jerusalem, “I will punish the ⸤arrogance⸥\f + \fr 10:12 \ft Literally “fruit of the greatness of the heart” \f* of the king of Assyria and ⸤his haughtiness⸥.”\f + \fr 10:12 \ft Literally “the pride of the height of his eyes” \f*
For he says,
“I have done \add it\add* by the strength of my hand
and by my wisdom, for I have understanding,
and I have removed \add the\add* boundaries of peoples,
and I have plundered their stores,
and like a bull I have brought down ⸤the inhabitants⸥.\f + \fr 10:13 \ft Or, “those sitting,” that is, rulers sitting on thrones \f*
And my hand has found, like \add a\add* nest, the wealth of the peoples,
and like the gathering of forsaken eggs, I myself have gathered all the earth.
And \add there\add* was no fluttering wing or open mouth or chirp.”
Does the ax boast against the one who cuts with it,
or the saw magnify itself against \add the\add* one who moves it to and fro?
⸤As if a rod should move the one who lifts it⸥!\f + \fr 10:15 \ft Literally “As a rod waving even the one who lifts it up” \f*
⸤As if a staff should lift up that which is not wood⸥!\f + \fr 10:15 \ft Literally “As a staff lifting up not wood” \f*
Therefore the Lord, Yahweh of hosts, will send leanness among his sturdy warriors,
and a burning like \add the\add* burning of fire will burn under his glory.
And the light of Israel will become like a fire,
and his holy one like a flame,
and it will burn and devour his thorns\f + \fr 10:17 \ft Hebrew “thorn” \f* and briers\f + \fr 10:17 \ft Hebrew “brier” \f* in one day.
And he will destroy the glory of his forest and orchard ⸤completely⸥,\f + \fr 10:18 \ft Literally “from soul and to body” \f*
and it will be like the wasting away of one who is sick.
And the rest of the trees\f + \fr 10:19 \ft Hebrew “tree” \f* of his forest will be a small number,
and a boy can write them \add down\add*.
The Return of the Remnant
And this shall happen: on that day, the remnant of Israel and the survivors\f + \fr 10:20 \ft Hebrew “survivor” \f* of the house of Jacob will not continue to lean on \add the\add* one who struck it
but will lean on Yahweh, the holy one of Israel, in truth.
A remnant will return—
the remnant of Jacob—to \add the\add* mighty God.
For though your people Israel was like the sand of the sea,
\add only\add* a remnant of it will return.
Annihilation \add is\add* determined,
overflowing \add with\add* righteousness.
For the Lord Yahweh of hosts \add is\add* about to make a complete destruction
and a determined end in the midst of all the earth.
Therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh of hosts:
“My people who live \add in\add* Zion,
you must not be afraid of Assyria.
It beats you with the rod,
and it lifts up its staff against you ⸤as the Egyptians did⸥.\f + \fr 10:24 \ft Literally “in the way of Egypt” \f*
\add My\add* indignation will come to an end ⸤in just a very little while⸥,\f + \fr 10:25 \ft Literally “for still a little a trifle” \f*
and my anger \add will be\add* directed to their destruction.”
And Yahweh of hosts is going to swing a whip against him,
as when Midian was defeated at the rock of Oreb;
and his staff \add will be\add* over the sea,
and he will lift him up ⸤as he did in Egypt⸥.\f + \fr 10:26 \ft Literally “in the way of Egypt” \f*
And this shall happen: on that day,
he will remove his burden from your shoulder
and his yoke from your neck,

⸤and a yoke will be destroyed because of fat⸥.\f + \fr 10:27 \ft The meaning of this phrase is uncertain, leading to the conjecture that it belongs with the next verse and by a different word division could mean “he has gone up from Jeshimon”; alternatively, “fat” could be a metaphor for prosperity \f*
He has come to Aiath,
he has passed through Migron;
at Micmash he deposited his baggage.
They crossed over \add the\add* pass;
Geba \add is\add* a place of overnight lodging for us.
Ramah trembles;
Gibeah of Saul has fled.
Daughter of Gallim, cry out \add with\add* your voice;
Laishah, listen!
⸤Anathoth is poor⸥.\f + \fr 10:30 \ft Or with different vocalization, “Answer her, Anathoth!” which fits the parallelism better \f*
Madmenah flees!
The inhabitants of Gebim bring themselves into safety!
⸤This day⸥\f + \fr 10:32 \ft Literally “Yet today” \f* ⸤taking a stand⸥\f + \fr 10:32 \ft Literally “to stand” \f* at Nob,
he will shake his fist \add at\add* the mountain of the daughter\f + \fr 10:32 \ft Following the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ); the consonantal text has “house” \f* of Zion,
\add at\add* the hill of Jerusalem.
Look! The Lord Yahweh of hosts is about to lop off \add the\add* branches\f + \fr 10:33 \ft Hebrew “branch” \f* with great power,
and ⸤the towering trees⸥\f + \fr 10:33 \ft Literally “the haughty of the height” \f* will be felled,
and the ⸤tall trees⸥\f + \fr 10:33 \ft Literally “height” \f* will be brought low.
And he will cut down the thickets of the forest with the axe,
and Lebanon will fall by \add the\add* mighty \add one\add*.
